intro: Bouvardia carmea, commonly known as the pink bouvardia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves that are opposite in arrangement. It thrives in warm climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Bouvardia carmea is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its long-lasting blooms and compact size.
